text:
Research Abstract
This is a research titled "The Sound Narrated Tradition Agreeing with the Explicit Rationality in Discussing Three Commentaries Arranged According to the Order of Revelation."
The researcher addressed it in two chapters:
As for the first chapter: The researcher discussed the topic of the arrangement of verses within the Surahs and provided evidence that it is a divinely ordained arrangement (Tawqifi). Then he discussed the topic of the arrangement of the Surahs and the schools of thought of scholars regarding it, then provided evidence that it is divinely ordained. Then he mentioned the beginning and source of opposing and contradicting this arrangement, then he touched upon mentioning the most prominent callers for it among the Orientalists and those contemporaries who were influenced by them - as well.
As for the second chapter: The researcher presented the three commentaries (Tafsir) that violated the Mushaf arrangement. Then he addressed the definition of each commentary, its author, his methodology, his creed, his motives for violating this arrangement, and the reasons for his inclination towards the chronological order of revelation. Then he discussed those motives and refuted them. Then he showed that the initiators of this door did not achieve their goals, then he concluded by stating the obligation of respecting the Mushaf arrangement upon which the Ummah agreed and received with acceptance.

Introduction
Praise be to Allah Who revealed His glorious Book in the best style and dazzled hearts with the beauty of its methods and the eloquence of its composition. He revealed it as clear verses, separated it into Surahs and verses, arranged it with His profound wisdom in the best arrangement, and organized it in the greatest system with the most eloquent wording and most profound composition. And may peace and blessings be upon him to whom it was revealed to warn with it and as a reminder upon his noble heart, so He removed constriction from him and expanded his chest, and upon his family and companions, emigrants and helpers... (1).
To proceed:

Preamble [*]
This is an important preamble presented by the researcher before this research, which he has titled "The Sound Narrated Tradition Agreeing with the Explicit Rationality in Discussing Three Commentaries Arranged According to the Order of Revelation." In it, the researcher pauses at important points regarding a number of characteristics and virtues of the Great Quran related to our research, as follows:

First: The Quran is the Eternal, Everlasting Miracle
The Holy Quran is the eternal miracle upon which the prophethood and message of the Seal of Prophets and Messengers, our Prophet Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, was built. Allah revealed it to him as His final Book and made it a miracle and proof of the truthfulness of his prophethood and message.
The confirmation of that is what is proven in the two Sahihs from the hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There is no prophet among the prophets but was given signs the like of which human beings believed in. And indeed, what I was given was a revelation that Allah revealed to me, so I hope that I will be the one with the most followers among them on the Day of Resurrection." (1)
And among the speech of Allah Almighty: The Great Quran, which is the clear Book of Allah, His strong rope, His straight path, and the revelation of the Lord of the Worlds. The Trustworthy Spirit brought it down upon the heart of the Master of Messengers, in a clear Arabic tongue. Revealed, not created; from Him it began and to Him it returns. It consists of decisive Surahs, clear verses, letters, and words. Whoever reads it and articulates it correctly has ten good deeds for every letter. It has a beginning and an end, parts and portions. It is recited by tongues, preserved in chests (hearts), heard by ears, written in Mushafs (copies). In it are clear and ambiguous [verses], abrogating and abrogated, specific and general, command and prohibition. (Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it; [it is] a revelation from a Wise, Praiseworthy [One]) (Fussilat: 42). (2)
So the Holy Quran—which is the Speech of Allah, His revelation, and His sending down—is revealed, not created, miraculous in its organization. Nothing of the speech of the created beings resembles it, nor is anyone of the created beings capable of its like. "That which is in the Mushafs of the Muslims; nothing has been missed from it, nor has it been lost by the forgetfulness of a person, nor the loss of a page, nor the death of a reciter, nor the concealment of a concealer. Nothing has been distorted from it, nor has a letter been added to it, nor has a letter been decreased from it. All of it is truth from Allah, even if the enemies of the Messengers (3) from the disbelievers, polytheists, atheists, and those who followed their path from the philosophers and people of desires denied it." (4)

Second: The Quran is the Miracle that Encompassed the Two Heavy Ones (Jinn and Mankind)
This miracle - the Quran - is a general miracle by which Allah challenged [creation], and the challenge encompassed both Jinn and Mankind. It is a miracle remaining as long as time remains, as our Lord said: (Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants.") (Al-Isra: 88).
This is a command from Allah to His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, to declare this challenge so that the Two Heavy Ones hear it, because the challenge has encompassed them all. He informed that even if all humans and Jinn gathered and agreed to produce the like of what He revealed to His Messenger, they would not be able to do so and would not manage it, even if they cooperated, helped, and supported one another, for it is a matter that cannot be done. (5)
The meaning of 'gathering' (Ijtima'): Agreement and unity of opinion, i.e., if the minds of humans and Jinn concurred that each one of them would bring the like of this Quran, they would not bring its like. It is a gathering of opinion, not a gathering of cooperation [initially], as indicated by the emphasis in His saying afterwards: "even if they were to each other assistants," - and this gathering is - a gathering of mutual support on one work and one purpose. (6)
The meaning intended here is that if their opinions agreed and their efforts combined together to bring the like of this Quran in its eloquence, rhetoric, beauty of style, splendor of expression, quality of casting, beauty of organization, firmness of meanings, perfection of purposes, and depth of aims; they would never be able to do that and would not manage to reach it, even if they united, gathered, and cooperated on that, supporting and aiding one another.
And His saying: (even if they were to each other assistants) means: They would not bring its like even if humans and Jinn cooperated and supported each other on that, so how about if they attempted that separately?! (7)
Allah challenged them to bring its like, or ten surahs like it fabricated, just as He challenged them to bring the shortest surah from it - as well - (8), so they were incapable of all that despite the availability of motives for them. How can a creature made of dust be capable of his speech being like the speech of the Lord of the Worlds? Or how can the deficient, poor in all aspects, serve to bring speech like the speech of the Perfect One, to whom belongs absolute perfection and vast richness from all aspects? This is not within possibility, nor within human capacity. Anyone with the slightest taste and knowledge of types of speech, if he weighs this Great Quran against others from the speech of the eloquent, the great difference will appear to him. (9)

Third: The Quran is the Miracle Whose Hearing is Considered a Proof
The challenge with this proof and its binding nature remains from its first revelation until the Quran is lifted at the end of time; indeed, the challenge with it remains - as well - until the Day of Resurrection. Allah Almighty confirmed the establishment of the proof by the Quran against the polytheists in His saying: (And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know) (At-Tawbah: 6).
Were it not that hearing it is a proof against him, his affair would not depend on hearing it, and it would not be a proof unless it is miraculous. (10)
The particle (In - If) was used, which is typically for a condition of rare occurrence; to alert that this is a hypothetical condition; so that the polytheists do not claim that they were not able to meet the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and take it as an excuse to persist in polytheism if the Muslims fought them. (11)

Fourth: The Quran - the Miracle - is the Speech of Allah, Revealed, Not Created
His saying: (so that he may hear the words of Allah) contains an explicit argument for the doctrine of Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah, who say that (the Quran is the Speech of Allah, not created); because He, the Exalted, is the One speaking it, and He attributed it to Himself as an attribution of an attribute to its described subject, and [it proves] the invalidity of the doctrine of the Mu'tazila and those who adopted their saying: that the Quran is created. (12)
And the statement: (The Quran is the Speech of Allah, not created) contains an explicit text that this which we read and recite is the very Speech of Allah. The voice is the voice of the reader, and the speech is the speech of the Creator; because Allah declared that this polytheist seeker of protection hears the Speech of Allah, recited to him by the Prophet of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. So this which is preserved in the chests, read by the tongues, written in the Mushafs; is the Speech of Allah, the Majestic and Exalted, in its meanings and words. (13)
The correct view which the predecessors (Salaf) of the nation are upon, such as Imam Ahmad and Al-Bukhari the author of the Sahih in the book (Creation of the Actions of Servants), and others, and all the Imams before them and after them - following the established texts and the consensus of the predecessors of the nation - is that the entire Quran is the Speech of Allah, its letters and its meanings; none of that is the speech of another... and that Allah speaks with a voice as came in the authentic Hadiths. (14)
Imam Al-Tahawi (d. 321 AH), may Allah have mercy on him, said: "Indeed the Quran is the Speech of Allah. From Him it began without modality as speech, and He sent it down to His Messenger as revelation. The believers believed him regarding that as truth, and they became certain that it is the Speech of Allah Almighty in reality, not created like the speech of creation. So whoever hears it and claims it is the speech of a human has disbelieved. Allah has condemned him, faulted him, and threatened him with Saqar (Hellfire) where He said: (I will drive him into Saqar) (Al-Muddaththir: 26). When Allah threatened with Saqar him who said (This is not but the word of a human being) (Al-Muddaththir: 25), we knew and became certain that it is the statement of the Creator of humans and it does not resemble the speech of humans." (15)
Ibn Abi Hatim (d. 327 AH), may Allah have mercy on him, said: "I asked my father and Abu Zur'ah about the doctrines of Ahl al-Sunnah regarding the fundamentals of religion, and what they found the scholars upon in all regions, and what they believe regarding that? They said: We found the scholars in all regions: Hijaz, Iraq, Sham, and Yemen, and their doctrine was: Faith is speech and action, it increases and decreases, and the Quran is the Speech of Allah, uncreated from all its aspects." (16)

Fifth: The Quran is the Speech of Allah - the Miracle - Allah Spoke it with Letter and Sound
The Quran, according to Ahl al-Sunnah, is the Speech of Allah Almighty in reality - letters and meanings - and that He, Glory be to Him, spoke it with letter and sound, and Gabriel heard it. The Salaf spoke about letter and sound and mentioned its evidences, and spoke on the ruling of whoever denies it. But when there appeared - among the people of innovation - those who deny the letter and sound to deny the Speech of Allah, the Salaf clarified that the Speech of Allah includes letters and meanings, and that He, Exalted is He, speaks with a sound, as they describe Him with what was reported of Speaking (Taklim), Calling out (Munadah), and Whispering (Munajah). (17)
Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Ismail Al-Bukhari (d. 256 AH), may Allah have mercy on him, said: I heard Ubaidullah bin Saeed say: I heard Yahya bin Saeed say: I have always heard our companions say: The actions of the servants are created. Abu Abdullah said: Their movements, their voices, their earning, and their writing are created. As for the Quran that is recited, clarified, established in the Mushaf, written, recorded, memorized in the hearts, it is the Speech of Allah, not created. Allah Almighty said: (Rather, the Qur'an is distinct verses [preserved] within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge) (Al-Ankabut: from verse 48). And Ishaq bin Ibrahim said: As for the vessels (hearts/books), who doubts in their creation?" (18)
Sheikh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah (d. 728 AH), may Allah have mercy on him, said: "If we read the Quran, we only read it with our created voices which do not resemble the voice of the Lord. The Quran which we read is the Speech of Allah, conveyed from Him not heard [directly] from Him. We only read it with our movements and voices; the speech is the speech of the Creator, and the voice is the voice of the reader, as indicated by the Book and the Sunnah along with reason. Allah Almighty said: (And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah then deliver him to his place of safety) (At-Tawbah: 6). And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: (Adorn the Quran with your voices)." (19)
The scholar Ibn al-Qayyim (d. 751 AH), may Allah have mercy on him, said in "Al-Kafiyah Al-Shafiyah":
"And Allah my Lord has never ceased speaking ... And His speech is heard by ears.
With truth and justice His words were perfected ... In command and information without decrease." (20)
And Sheikh Hafiz Hakami (d. 1377 AH), may Allah have mercy on him, said:
"And the saying regarding His detailed Book ... Is that it is His revelation sent down.
Upon the Chosen Messenger, best of creation ... It is not created nor fabricated.
It is preserved by the heart and by the tongue ... It is recited just as it is heard by ears.
Likewise by eyes it is looked at ... And by hands its script is written.
And everything possessing this (writing/reciting) is created in reality ... Except the Speech of the Creator of Creation.
Exalted are the attributes of our Lord the Merciful ... From being described with creation and temporal origination.
So the voice and melodies are the voice of the reader ... But the Recited is the Saying of the Creator.
What He said accepts no alteration ... No, and none is more truthful than Him in speech." (21)

Sixth: The Quran - the Miracle - is the Book that Dominated Over the Books Revealed Before It
Allah made the Quran dominant over previous books and a judge over them as He, Glory be to Him, said: (And We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming that which preceded it of the Scripture and as a criterion [Muhayminan] over it) (Al-Ma'idah: from verse 48).
And (Al-Muhaymin): The Trustee (Al-Amin). The Quran is a trustee over every book before it. (22)
(Wa Muhayminan): meaning: A judge over the books before it. (23)
(Wa Muhayminan 'alayh): meaning: Confirming it. Everything Allah revealed of Torah, Gospel, or Psalms, the Quran confirms that. And everything mentioned by Allah in the Quran confirms them and confirms that what occurred from them is truth. (24).
The Quran was dominant over the books because it is the Book that never becomes abrogated at all, and no alteration or distortion can approach it, according to the Almighty's saying: (Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian) (Al-Hijr: 9). (25)
- And - Allah made this Great Book which He revealed as the last of books and their seal, most comprehensive, greatest, and most perfect; as He gathered in it the beauties of the perfections of what was before it which are not in others. Therefore, He made it a witness, a trustee, and a judge over all of them. And He, the Exalted, guaranteed its preservation by His Noble Self, saying: (Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian) (Al-Hijr: 9). So it is preserved by the preservation of Allah Almighty until the Hour is established, a witness over these books, clarifying what was distorted of them, and ruling by what Allah approved and commanded of their laws, and abrogating what Allah abrogated of them, and it is a trustee over them in all that. (26)
Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah acknowledge that the Holy Quran is the Dominant Book and Judge over all previous revealed books, and the Preserver of every book before it; and a witness over all those books that they are revelation sent down from Allah Almighty which He revealed to His messengers, and that it confirms what is in them of truth, negating what falsehood was attached to them, and that it is a ruler over them by abrogation or confirmation. So whatever of them agrees with it is the Truth which Allah revealed, and whatever opposes it is of the falsehood attributed to them. Thus, the Quran has dominance over all those revealed books from every aspect.
- And - The Salaf are all agreed that the Quran is the Dominant (Muhaymin), the Trustee, the Witness over the books before it. (27)

Seventh: The Quran - the Miracle - is a Book Whose Verses are Perfected
The Holy Quran is a book whose verses were perfected and then detailed as our Lord said: (Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book whose verses are perfected and then presented in detail from [one who is] Wise and Acquainted) (Hud: 1). (Fussilat) means: Clarified. The origin of (Fasl) indicates distinguishing one thing from another, and separating it from it. (28).
And (Kitabun Uhkimat Ayatuhu thumma Fussilat): meaning: This Quran, Allah perfected its verses so there is no defect in them, nor falsehood, nor contradiction, then they were explained with truthful news and just rulings of commands and prohibitions. (29)
What do you say about the virtue of a book by which Allah saved a nation from ignorant ignorance and blind misguidance? Their habit was looting and plundering, their worshipped objects were idols and stones, their custom was inheriting enmities and grudges, not knowing a trace of truth. It was given what it found its fathers upon, and what its ancestors approved, of deviant opinions, invented sects, and innovated religions. So Allah revealed to them this Book, saved them from it by it, and pulled them out by it from its mud.

Eighth: The Quran - the Miracle - is a Book with Virtues Too Many to Count
- So - what do you say about the virtue of a book with which Allah sealed the Books, and revealed to a Prophet with whom He sealed the Prophets, and with a religion with which He sealed religions. (30)
What do you say about the virtue of a book by which cities were conquered, knees knelt before it, scholars drank from its fountain, literati drank from its watering place, sights humbled to its dominance, hearts submitted to it, and worshippers, bowers, and prostrators stood reciting it.
That is the Holy Quran: The totality of the Sharia, the pillar of the religion, the fountain of wisdom, the sign of the Message, and the light of eyes and insights. There is no path to Allah but it, no salvation without it, and no holding onto anything that contradicts it." (31)

Ninth: The Quran - the Miracle - has a Descending Order and a Mushaf Order for its Verses and Surahs which no one has the right to interfere with in any case

The First Arrangement: Arrangement of Verses in Surahs
One of the most prominent aspects of the miraculous nature of the Quran is the arrangement of its verses in its Surahs in one system, as if they were all revealed consecutively and arranged in this order which baffles human minds in the strength of its style, the beauty of casting its phrases, the goodness of its organization, and the interconnectedness of its verses as if they were pearls following one another. As if it is one piece in one poem revealed in this pattern, consecutively. Even though the chronological order of revelation of verses is different from this sequence and connection—verses might be revealed in a Surah and be late in their arrangement compared to other verses in the same Surah, and those verses might have been revealed after them—yet, you can never feel any defect or lack of connection in the thematic unity between the verses of a single Surah, or find in yourself the slightest doubt that they were revealed in this pattern of consecutive verses as if they were revealed in this Mushaf order.

The Second Arrangement: Arrangement of Quranic Surahs
Say the same regarding the Mushaf order of the Quran's Surahs. For the Mushaf order, according to its placement in the Mushafs spread among Muslims in the East and West of the world, is the arrangement settled upon by the Uthmani Mushafs upon which the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them all, agreed, and upon which the Predecessors (Salaf) and Successors (Khalaf) agreed and the Ummah received with acceptance. It is, moreover, completely in agreement with the Final Review (Al-Ardah Al-Akhirah) which is in agreement with the Quran established in the Preserved Tablet with the Lord of Glory in a hidden, preserved Book.

Tenth: Conclusion and Statement of the Witness from this Preamble
After explaining those great and majestic characteristics of the Quran—that it is the eternal remaining miracle indicating the truth of the prophethood and message of the Seal of Messengers, peace be upon him; that it is the miracle whose hearing is considered proof; that it is the Speech of Allah; that it is revealed and not created; that Allah Almighty spoke it with letter and sound; that it is a miracle by which Allah challenged the Two Heavy Ones; that it dominates over the books revealed before it and is a ruler and witness over them; that the arrangement of its verses came in the greatest form of pattern and wondrous connection as if they were revealed in this pattern; and that the Mushaf arrangement of Surahs and verses has been established in practice and consensus since Uthman burned the [other] Mushafs and united them on the Imam [Mushaf].

Three individuals have dared to violate the Mushaf arrangement by writing three commentaries according to the order of revelation. The researcher in this research discusses the authors of those three commentaries whose compilers violated the consensus of the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them all, and violated the consensus of the entire Ummah - as well -, by classifying those commentaries and arranging them according to the chronological order of the Surahs, leaving the Mushaf arrangement and throwing it behind their backs. Although they violated the consensus of the Ummah, they agreed in that with the enemies of the religion from the clique of Orientalists.
This study came to discuss the three individuals regarding their deed in which they dared upon this majestic work, opening upon the Ummah a great door of evil and a dangerous breach whose crack must be repaired and whose gap must be filled to block other great pretexts that might open the door to daring to tamper with the arrangement of verses just as it opened the door to violating the Mushaf arrangement of the Quran's Surahs agreed upon before, and upon which is the practice of the first and last of this shown-mercy Ummah.
Indeed, "the most important thing that the people of Allah's religion must uncover, and the first thing that must be researched, is what was a foundation for the origin of their religion, a pillar and system for the base of their monotheism, a proof of the truth of their Prophet, peace be upon him, and a confirmation and argument for his miracle, especially since ignorance has extended its canopy, hypocrisy is severe, and has taken over the horizons." (32)
Therefore, the motive for discussing these commentaries and refuting the motives of their compilers with argument, clarification, clear evidence, and shining proof, was victory for the Quran, and pleasing our Lord the Merciful.

The researcher included in his research a research plan consisting of two chapters, and under each chapter falls a number of sections (Mabahith), and under each section falls a number of requirements (Matalib). He clarified in it the following:

The research plan consists of two chapters as follows:

Chapter One: Divine Ordainment of the Mushaf Arrangement for Verses and Surahs
It includes six sections:
Section One: Clarifying that the arrangement of verses in Surahs is divinely ordained (Tawqifi).
It has two requirements:
The Mushaf arrangement includes two matters:
Requirement One: The First Matter: Arrangement of verses in Surahs.
Requirement Two: As for the Second Matter: It is the arrangement of Surahs according to the Mushaf arrangement.

Section Two: Of the clearest proofs that the arrangement of verses in Surahs is divinely ordained is the revelation of some Surahs all at once.
It has two requirements:
Requirement One: Mentioning a number of Surahs that were revealed all at once.
Requirement Two: Summary of mentioning Surahs that were revealed all at once.

Section Three: Schools of thought of scholars and their disagreement on the arrangement of Surahs.
It has three requirements:
Requirement One: The First School: That the arrangement of Surahs is a matter of Ijtihad (effort) by the Companions.
Requirement Two: The Second School: That the arrangement of Surahs is a matter of Divine Ordainment (Tawqifi) from the Prophet, peace be upon him.
Requirement Three: The Third School: That the arrangement of most Surahs is a matter of Divine Ordainment from the Prophet, peace be upon him, and that the arrangement of some Surahs was by Ijtihad from the Companions.

Section Four: Prominent sayings of scholars who say that the arrangement of the Holy Quran's Surahs was a divinely ordained arrangement.

Requirement Two: Mentioning a number of sayings of contemporary scholars.

The importance of this research centers around that audacity undertaken by the three individuals who introduced a grave matter, classifying three commentaries and writing them according to the chronological order, leaving behind their backs the Mushaf arrangement settled upon by the Uthmani sheets, agreed upon by all the Companions to the last one of them - may Allah be pleased with them all -, received by the Ummah with acceptance, and agreed upon by the Predecessors and Successors up to our present time.
From here comes the importance of this research. It was necessary and obligatory to present a study addressing this danger, discussing and refuting it, and repelling that tragedy with a fundamental scientific style coupled with transmitted and rational arguments. Therefore, the research was named "The Sound Narrated Tradition Agreeing with the Explicit Rationality in Discussing Three Commentaries Arranged According to the Order of Revelation."

Fourth: And among the clear observations on this research - as well - is its lack of biography of the authors of those commentaries for the reader to view and stand upon. It is a publication of the Center for Quranic Studies affiliated with the Muhammadiya Association of Scholars in Morocco, First Edition, 1438 AH / 2017 CE in a medium volume consisting of 168 pages. It is also a publication of: Dar Al-Aman for Publishing and Distribution, date: 06/06/2017 CE - as well. Its author is a professor of Tafsir and Quranic Sciences at Al-Qarawiyyin University, Faculty of Sharia Sciences in Smara.

Importance of that study:
The importance of that study comes from its distinct topic, which addresses the problematic issue of the call to arrange the Mushaf according to revelation, which has become a subject of controversy among modern scholars in recent times between supporters and opponents. This study came to discuss the topic in a descriptive, historical, analytical, critical methodology; which made it a fundamental critical approach seeking a calm objective scientific style.

Contents of that study:
The introduction of this study began by stating the importance of the topic of demanding the rearrangement of the Quran in Mushafs according to revelation; as there appeared among people in our time those who demand that, after the consensus of the predecessors since the Prophetic era was on the Mushaf arrangement of the Holy Quran. The author also clarified the motive for writing on the subject, which he summarized in: Writing in this chapter is considered an act of worship; that calls demanding rearrangement contain what is acceptable with conditions, and what is rejected; that in part of these calls there is a touching of the sanctity of the Mushaf; and that writing on this subject alerts to the sublime occasions contained in the Mushaf arrangement, from which the "Science of Quranic Proportionality" was generated; and that works discussing the topic of arrangement or interpretation according to revelation for the Holy Quran are considered few and rare.
The researcher paved the way for that study with a preliminary chapter, in which he addressed the methodology of Quranic revelation, including the concept and circumstances surrounding it, the purposes and objectives intended from the gradual revelation of the Quran, then the causes of revelation. He divided the book into two main sections. He dedicated the first of them to studying the Mushaf arrangement of the Holy Quran, clarifying the arrangement of verses in the Holy Quran, the arrangement of Surahs, the proportionality between verses and proportionality between Surahs, and the sayings of scholars on that, presenting the evidences of each group. He also dedicated the second section to the call for arranging and interpreting the Holy Quran according to the method of revelation, discussing those calling for that, as well as discussing their motives for this method and the extent of its applicability. He undertook a general critical discussion of Muhammad Abed Al-Jabri's claim regarding the arrangement of the Holy Quran's Surahs, and focused on partial issues related to interpretation according to revelation. The author appended his book with a conclusion containing the most important results reached by the research. (2)

Most important observations on that study:
The same observations and criticisms on the previous study apply in many aspects to this study, if not matching completely. Added to them is the author's saying: "that calls demanding rearrangement contain what is acceptable with conditions, and what is rejected." There is no doubt that this claim opens the door wide to the voices calling for rearranging the Quran chronologically.

It has two requirements:

Requirement One: Mentioning a number of Surahs that were revealed all at once
One of the clear evident proofs that the arrangement of verses in Surahs is Tawqifi is the revelation of some Surahs all at once. In classifying the revelation of Quranic Surahs, Al-Suyuti mentions the second type, which is the type that was revealed all at once, saying - may Allah have mercy on him: "... And among the examples of the second: Surah Al-Fatiha, Al-Ikhlas, Al-Kawthar, Tabbat, Lam Yakun, Al-Nasr, and Al-Mu'awwidhatan were revealed together. And from it is Surah Al-Saff." (1)
We cite some correct established evidences regarding the revelation of some Surahs all at once. Among those Surahs that were revealed all at once is Surah Bara'ah (At-Tawbah). Al-Bukhari narrated in his Sahih from Al-Bara' - may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "The last Surah revealed complete is Bara'ah." (2)
Al-Bukhari also narrated it (3) with the wording: "The last Surah revealed is Bara'ah..." without the word "complete". Some scholars held that Surah Bara'ah was revealed piecemeal and not all at once, claiming the incorrectness of the word "complete". Badr al-Din al-Ayni (d. 855 AH), may Allah have mercy on him, said: "His saying: (complete), Al-Dawudi said: The word: complete, is nothing because Bara'ah was revealed bit by bit. I said: Therefore the word: complete, was not mentioned in this Hadith in [the Book of] Tafsir, and its wording there is: The last Surah revealed is Bara'ah." (4)
But Al-Tahir bin Ashur mentioned in "Al-Tahrir wa Al-Tanwir" that it was revealed all at once and attributed this saying to the majority of scholars. (5)
Among those Surahs that were revealed all at once as well is Surah Al-Fath: Al-Bukhari narrated in his Sahih from Umar - may Allah be pleased with him from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: (Tonight a Surah has been revealed to me, it is dearer to me than all that the sun rises upon) then he read: (Indeed, We have given you a clear conquest) (Al-Fath: 1). (6)
Among those Surahs that were revealed all at once as well is Surah Al-Bayyinah: From Ammar bin Abi Ammar, he said: I heard Abu Habba Al-Badri say: When (Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture... were not) [Al-Bayyinah: 1] was revealed to its end, Gabriel - peace be upon him - said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed your Lord commands you to read it to Ubayy. So the Prophet, peace be upon him, said to Ubayy: (Indeed Gabriel commanded me to read this Surah to you). Ubayy said: Was I mentioned there, O Messenger of Allah? He said: (Yes). He said: So Ubayy wept. (7)

Section Three: Schools of thought of scholars and their disagreement on the arrangement of Surahs
It has three requirements:
Al-Suyuti - may Allah have mercy on him - says in "Al-Itqan" about the disagreement on the arrangement of Surahs:
As for the arrangement of Surahs as they are now in the Mushaf, the people of this discipline have differed on it into three schools:

Requirement One: The First School: That the arrangement of Surahs is a matter of Ijtihad (Tawfiqi - Success/Effort) by the Companions.
It is the doctrine of the majority who see that the arrangement of Surahs is a matter of Ijtihad by the Companions, as the Prophet, peace be upon him, delegated that to his nation after him. One of the most prominent who tended towards this opinion is Imam Malik.

Requirement Two: The Second School: That the arrangement of Surahs is a matter of Divine Ordainment (Tawqifi) from the Prophet, peace be upon him.
It sees that this arrangement is an instruction from the Prophet, peace be upon him, and this was said by a group of scholars.

Requirement Three: The Third School: That the arrangement of most Surahs is a matter of Divine Ordainment from the Prophet, peace be upon him, and that the arrangement of some Surahs was by Ijtihad from the Companions.
It leans towards that the arrangement of most Surahs was by instruction from the Prophet, peace be upon him, and was known in his life, and that the arrangement of some Surahs was by Ijtihad from the Companions. (1)
We have just passed what Al-Suyuti mentioned of scholars' sayings in stating the arrangement of Surahs generally. Allah Almighty sent it down all at once in the month of Ramadan on the Night of Decree to the lowest heaven, as the Almighty said: {The month of Ramadhan [is that] in which was revealed the Qur'an} (Al-Baqarah: 185), and He said: {Indeed, We sent it down during the Night of Decree} (Al-Qadr: 1)." (3)
Al-Baghawi's speech is of utmost precision. He sees that the Quran in our hands remains as it was in the Preserved Tablet, so it was arranged, and descended arranged to the lowest heaven with its complete verses and Surahs. And that although it descended piecemeal after that to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, it was collected by Revelation as it was in the Preserved Tablet, and the Companions - may Allah be pleased with them - wrote it according to this collection which they learned from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him.

The Tenth Saying: The saying of Mulla Ali Al-Qari (4) where he says - may Allah have mercy on him: "Although the most correct view is that the arrangement of Surahs is Tawqifi as well, even if their Mushafs were different in that before the Final Review... And among what indicates that it is Tawqifi is that the Hawamim were arranged successively, and likewise the Tawasin, while the Musabbihat were not arranged successively; rather separation occurred between their Surahs, and likewise the mixing of Meccan with Medinan Surahs." (5)
In the saying and evidence of Ali Al-Qari, it becomes clear that the arrangement, even if no theoretical text appeared regarding it, was more confirmed through contemplation of the practical application, which suggests in a way that leaves no room for doubt that the arrangement was Tawqifi. The gist of his speech is quoted from Al-Suyuti's saying.
Based on the above, scholars did not hesitate to prefer this opinion stating Tawqif. Ahmad bin Abdul Rahman bin Muhammad Al-Banna Al-Sa'ati said: "The correct view is that the arrangement of Surahs and verses is a Tawqifi matter with no room for opinion in it." (6)
Among what was organized and said in that is the saying of Abu Al-Hasan Ibn Al-Hassar (d. 620 AH) in his book "Al-Nasikh wa Al-Mansukh":
O you who ask me about the Book of Allah, striving ... And about the arrangement of what is recited of Surahs
And how the Chosen One from Mudar brought them ... May God bless the Chosen One from Mudar (7)
So Ibn Al-Hassar indicates that the arrangement of Surahs was brought by the Prophet - peace be upon him, and it is a signal...

Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "O people, do not go to extremes regarding Uthman, and say nothing but good for him regarding the Mushafs and burning the Mushafs. By Allah, he did not do what he did regarding the Mushafs except with consultation from us all." (1)
The saying of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, indicates that they agreed upon it by silent consensus - may Allah be pleased with them all.

Stance of Ibn Masud - may Allah be pleased with him:
Ibn Kathir - may Allah have mercy on him - said: "It was narrated about Abdullah bin Masud that he was angry when his Mushaf was taken from him and burned, and spoke about the precedence of his Islam over Zaid bin Thabit who wrote the Mushafs. So Uthman bin Affan - may Allah be pleased with him - wrote to him inviting him to follow the Companions in what they agreed upon of interest in that, uniting the word, and lack of difference. So Abdullah bin Masud returned (repented), and responded to following, and left opposition - may Allah be pleased with them all." (2)
The response of Ibn Masud - may Allah be pleased with him - to following in offering his Mushaf for burning reinforces what we mentioned earlier of the saying of Ali bin Abi Talib - may Allah be pleased with him. It strengthens, confirms, and reinforces the saying of silent consensus on one hand, and establishes the actual consensus on the other hand as well. May Allah be pleased with them all.
Regarding that, Al-Zarqani (d. 1367 AH) says in his "Manahil" - while reviewing the evidences of those saying Tawqif: "That the arrangement of all Surahs is Tawqifi by the teaching of the Messenger - peace be upon him - like the arrangement of verses, and that no Surah was placed in its position except by his command, peace be upon him. The proponents of this opinion argued that the Companions agreed on the Mushaf written in the era of Uthman and none of them dissented. Their consensus is not complete unless the arrangement they agreed upon was from Tawqif (instruction), because if it were from Ijtihad, the owners of differing Mushafs would have held onto their difference. But they did not hold onto it, rather they turned away from it and their arrangement, and turned away from their Mushafs and burned them and returned to Uthman's Mushaf and its arrangement entirely. Then they cited narrations for their doctrine as evidences on which consensus relies." (3)
Even if we conceded for the sake of argument that the arrangement of the Mushaf was initially an Ijtihadi arrangement not Tawqifi, we would say that the consensus of the Ummah has settled on the Mushaf arrangement. Even all books of Tafsir are on this matter; we do not know of any dissenter among them from the Predecessors and Successors, but three individuals from the contemporaries deviated from that (4). Therefore, it is not permissible, the case being so, to breach this work upon which the Ummah agreed. This precise arrangement mentioned by Al-Suyuti for Surahs similar in their opening and beginning and the manner of their order and succession with that extreme precision of "Al Ha-Mim" Surahs and "Al Ta-Sin-Mim" Surahs, since the seven "Al Ha-Mim" Surahs were arranged successively, as well as the three "Al Ta-Sin-Mim" Surahs. First Goal: Avoiding what exegetes fell into of repetition leading to the hugeness of their commentaries.
Sheikh Mulla Huwaish did not provide us a comparison between his commentary and other commentaries where repetition occurred so we could be clear about what he says. Then how does an exegete - including "Mulla Huwaish" - avoid verses revealed in the Meccan stage generally like the verses of Surat Al-Isra containing commands to adhere to fundamental morals, then revealed in Surat Al-An'am, also Meccan, and very close to what appeared in Surat Al-Isra. Say the same regarding what appeared in Surat Al-Ma'arij (Meccan) and Surat Al-Mu'minun of attributes and deeds that are almost identical, and Sheikh "Mulla Huwaish" himself interpreted them here and there. Say the same regarding the stories of Prophets which were repeated many times, sometimes in general, sometimes in detail, and other times addressing an aspect of the Prophets' lives or a method of their call. Like the story of Abraham, peace be upon him, story of Noah, peace be upon him, and story of Moses, peace be upon him. The exegete has no choice but to proceed with the verses and present the miraculous Quranic style in presenting the matter and alert to the special aspect mentioned each time. He can refer to the preceding place in the commentary as most exegetes do; they often refer the reader to some preceding details saying: We mentioned the detail of this matter in Surah such and such when discussing such and such. (1)
As for the Sheikh's saying that the hugeness of ancient commentaries was caused by repetition, I say the cause of the hugeness of commentaries is the sciences and contents they addressed, and the aspects they exposed in interpreting verses, of doctrinal, linguistic, or jurisprudential issues, or refutations of some sayings...

Second Goal: Avoiding difference in causes of revelation and abrogating and abrogated:
I did not understand what the Sheikh meant by avoiding difference in causes of revelation and abrogating and abrogated. It is known that narrations are reported regarding causes of revelation, some authentic and some sick (weak). The exegete must study these narrations, take the authentic narration, and leave the other. What does that have to do with the order of revelation?! The Sheikh did that, but he did not do it consistently - he used to do it sometimes - so he did not commit to taking the authentic always but took the weak narration, and might leave the authentic one sometimes.
Similar is the case in abrogating and abrogated. Rulings reported in some verses where combining these verses is impossible and we know the time of revelation of both verses, we judge with the abrogation of the earlier revealed verse, as recorded in the rules of preponderance (Tarjih) among scholars of Tafsir and scholars of Usul al-Fiqh. Whether the interpretation of the Quran is according to the Mushaf arrangement or according to the revelation arrangement, the study of the two verses takes a specific dimension and defined methodology in study and comparison. The two verses of waiting period for the widow in Surat Al-Baqarah (1), the abrogating verse is advanced in the arrangement of verses, and the abrogated verse is delayed in arrangement. Despite that, there was no problem for any exegete in mentioning the abrogating verse and determining the ruling of the abrogated, because interpreting both verses and determining the later in revelation of them is necessary, then clarifying the contradiction and consequently judging the abrogation of one of them.

As for the Third Goal: Sheikh "Mulla Huwaish's" saying: To inform the reader how the Quran was revealed and its dependence on causes of its sending down:
This aspect was exhaustively researched by exegetes, as they mentioned the time of revelation of the Surah and verses and mentioned narrations determining causes of revelation. They left nothing small or big in that except they mentioned it. In fact, Sheikh "Mulla Huwaish" and those who followed him in interpreting according to the order of revelation were dependent on previous exegetes in taking narrations mentioning the Meccan or Medinan nature of the Surah, and clarifying causes of revelation. They mentioned all that while adhering to the arrangement of Surahs as they appeared in the Mushaf.

As for the Fourth Goal: Sheikh "Mulla Huwaish's" saying: So the reader tastes the pleasure of Quran's meanings and the taste of the brevity of its structures in an easy, facilitated image...
What is the relationship of tasting the pleasure of Quran's meanings with arrangement? Tasting meanings comes in interpreting the Surah with an eloquent beautiful style, so what does that have to do with arrangement? That comes from the methodology followed by the exegete in his book of interpreting Quran by Quran...

Section Two: Presentation, study, and discussion of the second commentary "Al-Tafsir Al-Hadith" by "Muhammad Izzat Darwaza" (d. 1404 AH)
It has eight requirements:

Requirement One: Definition of his commentary
It is the second of those commentaries whose authors followed a specific path not followed by the Salaf in arranging Surahs chronologically, not according to the Mushaf. His commentary contained the entire Holy Quran, and he arranged it according to the order of revelation. Two editions of it were issued: The first in year: 1964 CE - in Cairo at Isa Al-Babi Al-Halabi Press, and it is a beautiful and valuable edition. The second, which is revised and corrected from the author's copy, was issued in year 2000 CE by Dar Al-Gharb Al-Islami in Beirut. It was issued in twelve parts collected in six volumes. He died, may Allah have mercy on him, in Shawwal of the year 1404 AH.

Requirement Two: "Darwaza's" argument for undertaking the change of the Mushaf arrangement to the chronological arrangement
Professor "Darwaza" prefaced the introduction of his commentary with some fatwas upon which he relied and justified this deed of his. They are the fatwa of Sheikh Abu Al-Yusr Abidin and Sheikh Abdul Fattah Abu Ghuddah. They gave him a fatwa of permissibility, distinguishing between the two arrangements, clarifying that the Mushaf arrangement is for recitation, and that the arrangement of commentary differs from the arrangement in recitation. "Darwaza" prefaced his commentary with them as we mentioned, and they are as follows:
The First: By the Mufti of Syria "Abu Al-Yusr Abidin", and its text is: "Commentary is not a Quran to be recited, so that the arrangement of verses and Surahs is observed in it. An exegete can interpret a verse, then leave what is next to it due to the clarity of its meaning, and can interpret a Surah, then leave what is after it relying on understanding the next. There is no objection to authoring a commentary in the mentioned form, and Allah knows best."
The Second: By "Abdul Fattah Abu Ghuddah", in it came: "The suspicion of prohibition of this method comes from the side that it is a method contradicting what the Noble Mushaf is upon. Repelling it...

The book (Ta'wil Mushkil al-Quran) by Ibn Qutaybah is considered among the most precious written in refuting atheists and heretics who attacked the Quran and described it as containing problematic things. Requirement Five: "Darwaza's" method in his commentary
"Darwaza" followed in his commentary the rhetorical and analytical method. He also frequently addressed the interpretation of some verses by the thematic interpretation method. He arranged it chronologically, not according to the Mushaf. His book (The Glorious Quran) was like an introduction to his commentary titled "Al-Tafsir Al-Hadith".
Among his most prominent topics and interests were the following:
1 - He spoke about the styles of the Quran, and also spoke about its impact.
2 - He addressed in his commentary also the collection of the Quran, its recording, reading, Mushaf script, and method of its organization.
3 - He also addressed the ideal way to interpret the Quran, and the path leading to understanding it.
4 - He was interested in casting some looks at a number of works in Tafsir, and spoke about the ways and methods followed by their authors.
5 - He also addressed explaining Quranic occasions (Munasabat) and causes and history of revelation of verses.
6 - He took care to define Surahs before exposing their interpretation, a definition covering several aspects which he clarifies and elucidates by saying: "We saw in addition to this that it is useful to place an introduction or brief definition of Surahs before starting their interpretation, including their description, contents, most important features, and what comes to mind from their content regarding the correctness of their arrangement in revelation and in the Mushaf, and what is in Meccan Surahs of Medinan verses, and in Medinan Surahs of Meccan verses according to narrations, and commenting on that as required." (1)
7 - He was sometimes attentive and alert to Israelite stories and Jewish news and warned against them as well. Among the clearest of that is his comment on the story of Harut and Marut where he says: "Ancient exegetes cited numerous narrations containing the strange and odd, differing in formula and detail, agreeing in essence... Ibn Kathir cited a strange forged narration to Mother of Believers Aisha... Al-Qasimi mentioned that Al-Razi in his commentary decided the invalidity of narrations from several aspects, and that Imam Abu Muslim argued for the invalidity of magic descending on them from several aspects also, which we saw no point or necessity in citing) (2)

The book is: "Ma'arij al-Tafakkur wa Daqa'iq al-Tadabbur" (The Ascents of Reflection and Subtleties of Pondering).

Requirement Three: The methodology of "Habannaka" in his book, his opinion on the arrangement of Surahs, and what was obligatory upon him to follow

A- His methodology in his book:
Among the most prominent features of his methodology in his book are the following: Sheikh "Habannaka" followed in his ponder-based commentary a path we summarize briefly as follows:
First: He mentioned in the beginning of his book pondering-related rulings concerning Isti'adha (seeking refuge) and Basmalah.
Second: He mentions the Meccan and Medinan of the Surah, then clarifies the reported opinions about it, then prefers between them and clarifies what he went to and chose.
Third: He mentions the Surah in its full length, then turns to mentioning the aspects of readings reported in it.
Fourth: He mentions the Surah and what was reported in it of virtues, especially regarding the subject of his research, inferring from texts of the Sunnah and traces of the Salaf in that.
Fifth: He followed an objective method in dividing the Surah, then studied it an objective analytical study, then followed that with a comprehensive look at all topics contained in the Surah.
Sixth: He addresses jurisprudence rulings and some rhetorical issues sometimes, especially when there is a reason to mention them.

B- His opinion, may Allah have mercy on him, on the arrangement of Surahs:
We have passed the saying of Sheikh "Huwaish" and Professor "Darwaza" regarding the arrangement of Surahs and that it is Tawqifi according to them. As for Sheikh "Habannaka", he undertook interpreting the Quran according to the order of revelation, and this is a grave matter in which he has no Imam (predecessor), except what was from his two companions Sheikh "Huwaish" and Professor "Darwaza" as we knew. Yet they presented arguments and justifications for the work they undertook, even if they were all falling, unconvincing. We have passed the discussion and refutation of the justifications they presented.
As for Sheikh "Habannaka": He sees that the arrangement of Surahs is an Ijtihadi matter, contrary to his "two companions" "Huwaish" and "Darwaza", and he did not present arguments nor proofs like his two companions.

C- What was obligatory upon him to follow:
Therefore, several matters were obligatory upon him, most importantly:
First: Presenting the sayings of those who say the arrangement of Surahs is Tawqifi and clarifying their arguments and evidences.
Second: Discussing the sayings and evidences of those saying Tawqif, and clarifying the evidences of what he went to and preferred.
Third: Conveying the consensus of the Companions and the settling of their opinion on the Imam Mushaf and their acceptance and submission to it.
Fourth: Conveying the consensus of the Ummah on accepting the Tawqifi arrangement of Surahs upon which the Imam Mushaf settled and work continues upon it from the time of Uthmani collection to our time.

And because the recitation of every individual is not established in a special Mushaf he has, rather each of them recites and memorizes from one Mushaf in its Mushaf arrangement which the Ummah agreed upon, predecessors and successors, and its acceptance occurred by consensus and work on it is ongoing in the Ummah through all its generations. So altering the Mushaf arrangement is safe and secure [from happening in the written text]. And Allah knows best.
Among what indicates that is what is proven in Muslim from the hadith of Hudhayfa bin Al-Yaman, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I prayed with the Prophet, peace be upon him, one night, so he started Al-Baqarah. I said: He will bow at the hundred. Then he continued. I said: He will pray with it in one Rak'ah. So he continued. I said: He will bow with it. Then he started An-Nisa and read it, then started Al-Imran and read it. He reads slowly. If he passes a verse containing glorification, he glorifies. If he passes a request, he asks. If he passes seeking refuge, he seeks refuge. Then he bowed... Hadith. (1)
In a similar vein, Al-Nawawi, may Allah have mercy on him, says in Al-Tibyan: "Scholars, may Allah have mercy on them, said: The choice is to read according to the order of the Mushaf. So he reads Al-Fatiha, then Al-Baqarah, then Al-Imran, then An-Nisa until he finishes with (Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind), whether he reads in prayer or outside it. It is also desirable if he reads a Surah to read after it the Surah that follows it. If he reads in the first Rak'ah: (Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind), he reads in the second from Al-Baqarah. The evidence for this is: That the arrangement of the Mushaf is for a wisdom, so it should be maintained except where the Sharia reported an exception, like the Morning Prayer on Friday, he reads in the first Rak'ah: (Alif Lam Mim Tanzil) [Al-Sajdah] and in the second: (Has there come) [Al-Insan], and the two Eid prayers (Qaf) and (The Hour has drawn near) [Al-Qamar]. If he violated the order and read a Surah then read the one before it, or violated consecutiveness and read before it what does not follow it, it is permissible but he was leaving the better. As for reading the Surah from its end to its beginning, it is agreed upon its prohibition and condemnation; for it removes some types of miraculousness, and removes the wisdom of arrangement." (2)
And just as he used to read in Jumu'ah sometimes Al-Jumu'ah in the "First" and Al-Ghashiyah in the "Second".

Third: Since the Mushaf arrangement has been agreed upon by the Ummah, predecessors and successors, and work has proceeded on it, no one whomever he is has the right to breach the consensus which is a proof in itself and deviate from it to other types of arrangement, be it chronological, thematic, historical or otherwise upon which the work of those who collected the Quran in its three eras did not proceed, nor did the work of anyone who followed them in goodness proceed. Whether this Mushaf arrangement is a Tawqifi arrangement, or an Ijtihadi arrangement. That is for the protection and preservation of the Book of Allah Almighty from alteration, change, and distortion, and because of what results from that of corruptions and calamities whose consequences are not praised. From here was the duty to confront such work and highlight it to the servants from time to time in victory for the Book of Allah Almighty and refuting the attacks of the attackers and doubters in the Book of the Lord of the Worlds from all enemies of the religion and creed, those whose mind does not calm nor decision settle nor stop attacking the Book of Allah Almighty, and they work and strive in that day and night across time and place. And returning their arrows to their throats so they return to their people losers, and retreat defeated, and return to their holes humiliated, and turn back belittled.
Yes, they do that as advice for Allah Almighty and His Book as the First Siddiq (Abu Bakr), may Allah be pleased with him, stood and confronted the withholders of Zakat on the Day of Apostasy, and as the Revered Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal Al-Shaybani, Imam of Ahl al-Sunnah, stood for the Book of Allah on the Day of Trial (Mihnah).
So confronting these and their likes and tails was among the most obligatory duties on those concerned with this great matter among those stationed on the frontiers of Islam and its protectors, and those jealous for their religion and the Book of their Lord, and those who love to be included in their Lord's description of them (and those who followed them in goodness) so His promise of His pleasure with them is realized for them, may Allah be pleased with them, in His saying Almighty: (And the first forerunners [in the faith] among the Muhajireen and the Ansar and those who followed them with good conduct - Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him, and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment) (At-Tawbah: 100).
All that is striving to realize the promise of their Lord which does not fail, nor delay, nor alter, nor change ever, about which He, Glory be to Him, said: (Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian) (Al-Hijr: 9).

Concluding this section, we cite a subtle point for Al-Albani - the Muhaddith of the era - may Allah have mercy on him: This question was directed to him: What is the purpose of collecting the Quran and placing it in the Mushaf, and is the arrangement of Surahs in the Mushaf Tawqifi or Ijtihadi?
Among what he answered after a long speech - may Allah have mercy on him - was the following:
"... I don't know, I don't know. Here the issue is said to be a worship issue (Ta'abbudiyyah) because the arrangement of the Quran is not according to history, the chronological history you refer to. This is an issue in which scholars differed whether it is Tawqifi or Ijtihadi, unlike when a verse is organized and placed in a Surah, this is Tawqifi with certainty. As for the arrangement of Surahs, their advancement and delay, for example 'Recite in the name of your Lord' supposed according to the question posed earlier to be placed in the first of what was revealed, yet it was placed in the last of what was revealed. They differed in this arrangement for Surahs not in the arrangement of verses in the Surah. The arrangement of verses in the Surah is Tawqifi without any hesitation. As for the arrangement of Surahs as it is now in the Mushaf, they differed. Some of them say this is Tawqifi also from...

As for me personally, I do not have a decisive opinion on the subject, but I say if the preponderant view is that it is Tawqifi, then here comes the answer to the previous question: Allah knows best. And if it is by Ijtihad from those who collected the Quran after the Messenger, peace be upon him, and classified it after him on this classification, then I did not know what the wisdom is. Therefore, I leave knowledge to its Knower." (1)
Let us contemplate how a flag among the flags (scholar) and a master among the masters of people says such words: (I don't know, I don't know... I did not know what the wisdom is... Therefore, I leave knowledge to its Knower) [May Allah have mercy on Al-Albani, that godly scholar. Our research and wandering in what was mentioned has been long due to the greatness of the matter. Allah, Glory be to Him, alone is behind the intent, and He is our sufficiency and best disposer of affairs. Our last prayer is that praise be to Allah Lord of the Worlds].

Research Conclusion
In the conclusion of this very important study, the researcher praises his Generous Lord, the Bestower of favor, grace, and blessing for what He bestowed - Glory be to Him - upon His poor weak servant of completing a research in a manner by which he hopes for excuse before Allah and reaching the argument and clarity of the path for every fair person hoping to follow the truth and walk the path of the believers in following what the Predecessors and Successors agreed upon of following the Mushaf arrangement with which the Quran was revealed and upon which Uthman's sheets settled and the Ummah received with acceptance, and upon which work continues since Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him, gathered the Ummah on the Imam (Mushaf) until our present time.

Statement of the most important results reached by that brief study
That humble study reached important results, perhaps the most prominent are:
1 - If the arrangement of verses in Surahs is Tawqifi, then the arrangement of the Holy Quran's Surahs is Tawqifi - as well.
2 - That the Mushaf arrangement is what the Ummah has acted upon since Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him, gathered the Ummah on the Imam. The Companions - may Allah be pleased with them - agreed upon it, and the Ummah received it with acceptance, and work is upon it to our present time.
3 - That Orientalists are the first who opposed and contradicted the Mushaf arrangement with the chronological arrangement and demanded rearranging the Quran chronologically. Some contemporaries were influenced by them.
4 - That the first who responded to the command of Orientalists and followed their path and opposed the path of believers in working with the Mushaf arrangement upon which is the work of the Ummah, predecessors and successors, are the three individuals whom we studied together and discussed their work in violating the Mushaf arrangement and inclining towards the chronological...

5 - That the three individuals - authors of the three commentaries - argued with flimsy arguments, frailer and weaker than a spider's web. It has become clear with us in the folds of the research the refutation of those flimsy arguments with clear proofs and shining evidences by rational and transmitted arguments.
6 - That the goals aimed for by the initiators of changing the Mushaf arrangement to the chronological arrangement were not achieved at all - in that is a decisive indication of the invalidity of what they aimed for and intended.
7 - That it has been proven by decisive evidence and by rational and transmitted arguments and proofs that the Mushaf arrangement is what the Ummah's practice and the consensus of Predecessors and Successors is upon. So how about when it is proven that it is Tawqifi? Therefore, it must be respected, not interfered with, and those who interfere with it must be confronted.
8 - The concerned bodies in the Ummah must warn against such audacity on the Book of Allah Almighty and prevent any works similar to what the authors of the three commentaries undertook. They must also rearrange those commentaries according to the Mushaf arrangement. This is also an imperative obligation on the heirs of the authors of those commentaries, all according to ability and capacity.
9 - The fatwas issued by some of those affiliated with knowledge to the authors of those commentaries did not agree with the truth upon which is the path of believers, and upon which is the work of the first and last of the best of this Ummah. So they are not relied upon and not acted according to, due to their contradiction to the truth upon which is the consensus of the predecessors and successors of the Ummah.
And our last prayer is that praise be to Allah Lord of the Worlds. [*].

1. [*] (Shamela Comment): The conclusion came in what was sent by the author - may Allah preserve him - with difference in phrases, as follows: Conclusion of the research, and stating the most important results reached by that brief study
A- Conclusion of the Research: In the conclusion of this research, the researcher praises his Generous Lord, the Bestower of favor for what He bestowed of discussing this research, studying it, and clarifying the violation of the Mushaf arrangement and inclining away from it to the chronological arrangement followed by the authors of the three commentaries. He hopes to have been successful in it to hit the truth and follow the path of believers who agreed on the Tawqif of the Mushaf arrangement and the obligation of adhering to it and not deviating from it.
B- Most Important Results reached by that brief study: That humble brief study reached several important results, the researcher summarizes the most prominent as follows:
First: That the Mushaf arrangement includes two matters:
As for the first matter: It is the arrangement of verses in Surahs, and that it is a Tawqifi arrangement with no disagreement in that ever.
As for the second matter: It is the arrangement of Surahs according to the Mushaf arrangement. The researcher presented in it the schools of scholars and their disagreement on it. The opinion that the arrangement of Surahs is a Tawqifi matter from the Prophet, peace be upon him, was preponderant to him. It must be respected and it is not permissible to violate it in any case for the following reasons:
a- Because it is the arrangement upon which the Final Review settled.
b- And because it is the arrangement agreeing with the Quran established in the Preserved Tablet.
c- And because it is the arrangement upon which the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, agreed.
d- And because it is the arrangement which the Ummah received with acceptance.
e- And because it is the arrangement upon which is the work of Predecessors and Successors.
Second: That the beginning of opposing and contradicting the Mushaf arrangement with the chronological arrangement had its first source in some Orientalists, who retreated from that work when the futility of their deed became clear to them and they regretted the time they wasted in it without benefit.
Third: That the first who breached the gathering of the Ummah and contradicted what the Predecessors and Successors agreed upon of working on the Mushaf arrangement and dared to violate it following and imitating the Orientalists, are the authors of the three commentaries which the researcher presented and discussed. And that these three individuals intended to author and classify those commentaries and write and arrange them according to the chronological order, leaving and throwing behind their backs the Mushaf arrangement upon which the Uthmani sheets settled and upon which the Companions - may Allah be pleased with them all - agreed, and it is the arrangement upon which the Final Review settled, and it is the arrangement agreeing with the Quran established in the Preserved Tablet as passed with us previously.
Fourth: After presenting, studying, and discussing those three commentaries arranged according to the order of revelation, the following became clear to us:
1 - The invalidity of this work entirely and in detail.
2 - The invalidity of the flimsy arguments presented by the authors of those three commentaries.
3 - The non-achievement of the goals aimed for by the initiators of changing the Mushaf arrangement to the chronological arrangement.
4 - After clarifying the invalidity of the flimsy arguments relied upon by these three individuals and the non-achievement of their goals they aimed for, it is obligatory on the general Ummah to adhere to the Mushaf arrangement agreed upon by the Predecessors and Successors and not to deviate from it to other types of arrangement, whether chronological, thematic, historical or otherwise upon which the work of those who collected the Quran in its three eras did not proceed, nor did the work of anyone who followed them in goodness.
5 - The obligation of adhering to the Mushaf arrangement on everyone, and people in that are equal. This is for those who see it is a Tawqifi arrangement, and for those who see it is an Ijtihadi arrangement. That is for protection and preservation from changing the organization of the Quran and preservation of the Book of Allah Almighty from any alteration, change, or distortion, and because of what results from that work and this arrangement of great corruptions and major calamities whose consequences are not praised.
6 - That it is obligatory on general researchers in the Quran and its sciences and on the concerned scientific bodies in the Ummah to be fully vigilant for everything that emerges and is published of researches and works supporting this change and alteration contrary and opposite to the Mushaf arrangement or authoring works different from it, with care to highlight researches, studies, and grounded scientific theses concerned with this aspect as protection and victory for the Holy Quran.
7 - The concerned bodies - as well - must address the heirs of the authors of the three commentaries to refrain from what their work proceeded on and modify it according to the Mushaf arrangement, taking into account the obligation of alerting to the doctrinal and methodological observations taken against those commentaries, especially the commentary "Bayan al-Ma'ani" by "Mulla Huwaish", although not reprinting it and warning against taking and circulating it due to what it contained between its sides of calamities and major corruptions is the priority, more correct, and right.
